meta.title: From SPINNING to JENNY
meta.author: Sandy Weisz and Mao Reynolds
meta.message: America's birthday is this week. To celebrate, we're featuring inventions that were born around the same time as the USA. The Spinning Jenny was invented in 1764 by James Hargreaves. It allowed one worker to spin multiple spools of thread at once, greatly increasing productivity in textile manufacturing.

ladder.clue: Drop two letters from ^ for a baseball term
___ ^, the final stretch in a normal game
Move the last letter of ^ to the front to get something thrown?
^ team named after a piece of ^ equipment
Anagram ^ to get an email mailbox
Change first letter in ^ to get a homophone of ^ that's worth almost nothing
Change one letter in ^ to get a name
